name: Children's Rights Alliance Ireland
goal:
The Children’s Rights Alliance unites over 100 organisations to make Ireland one of the best places in the world to be a child. Our mission is to realise the rights of children in Ireland through securing full implementation of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child.

Within the life of our current Strategic Plan 2017-2021, the Children’s Rights Alliance has six strategic objectives. These six strategic objectives have been developed with the aim of progressing the realisation of children’s rights and ensuring a measureable improvement in the State’s response on each of the Alliance’s priority issues.

1. To secure changes in law to give meaningful effect to children’s rights.
2. To shape national policy to give meaningful effect to children’s rights and drive momentum across the State to meet its obligations to children and young people.
3. To drive home the need to invest in children early and build political support for greater access to quality services to ensure that children’s rights are fulfilled.
4. To promote access to child-friendly justice in civil, criminal and administrative proceedings.
5. To put a spotlight on serious children’s rights violations, in particular, the rights of children seeking international protection and in direct provision.
6. To continue to build a strong membership and ensure that the Children’s Rights Alliance has the people, systems, structures, procedures and resources in place to deliver on our strategic objectives.
interests: Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Home Affairs, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Youth
euInitiatives: We are members of Eurochild, a network of organisations and individuals working in and across Europe to promote the rights and well-being of children and young people.
